trial_identification.studytitle: Psycholinguistic and school performance of brothers with myelomeningocele
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Psycholinguistic and school performance of brothers with myelomeningocele

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Conditions of unknown or disputed aetiology (such as chronic fatigue syndrome/myalgic encephalomyelitis)

interventions.interventions: We performed assessment of psycholinguistic skills and school siblings with myelomeningocele through the application of informal procedures (in-depth interview with family members, the Communicative Behavior Observation) and formal (Picture Peabody Vocabulary Test , Illinois Test of Psycholinguistic Abilities, Profile Phonological Abilities, Test of Educational Achievement and Recognition of letters and numbers. These procedures were applied to two participants in separate rooms. The procedures were applied in the course of 4 sessions of 50 minutes, finishing the evaluation process in a month.
interventions.comparator: There was no control group to be a case study of two siblings with myelomeningocele.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in psycholinguistic skills and academic achievement with aplication of tests and symbolic actions of tools. The tests are: Observation of Communicative Behavior, Peabody Picture Vocabulary Test (PPVT - Dunn et al. 1986), Illinois Test of Psycholinguistic Abilities (ITPA - Bogossian, 1984), Phonological Abilities Profile (PAP - Alvarez, et al. 2004), School Performance Test (SPT - Stein, 1994) and recognition of letters and numbers (RLN).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Only one evaluation. Evaluation was conducted in 4 sessions of 50 minutes

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Reflection of changes in types of environment education, family and society, assessed by aplication of tests and observastion of behaviour during the sessions. The tests are: Observation of Communicative Behavior, Peabody Picture Vocabulary Test (PPVT - Dunn et al. 1986), Illinois Test of Psycholinguistic Abilities (ITPA - Bogossian, 1984), Phonological Abilities Profile (PAP - Alvarez, et al. 2004), School Performance Test (SPT - Stein, 1994) and recognition of letters and numbers (RLN).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed after completion of the study and analysis of data.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Faculty of Dentistry of Bauru Universidade de Sao Paulo
